result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Winiecki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Mistreatment of Animals/Cause Death, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pursuant to sec. 973.09(3) Wis. Stats., the probation term may be extended if the defendant does not make a good faith effort at paying restitution.  Otherwise, any unpaid restitution will be converted to a civil judgment upon discharge or revocation.  The probation agent shall advise the court of amounts due and owing prior to discharge or revocation.

If not timely paid in full, defendant may be ordered to spend one day in the county jail for each $50.00 amount owed, with huber privileges, and the remaining unpaid obligation will be docketed & enforced as a civil judgment against the defendant. The defendant shall keep the Clerk of Court's office advised of any change of address until the obligation is paid in full.
Defendant shall submit to and comply with any evaluation, assessment, counselling and/or treatment, as deemed appropriate by Probation Agent and shall pay all applicable costs of same

If defendant has not already done so, he/she shall provide a biological specimen to the State Crime Laboratory for deoxyribonucleic acid analysis (DNA testing) pursuant to Section 973.047(1f) Wis. Stats.  
Defendant eligible for early discharge upon full payment of restitution if Agent approves.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
